result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin B Hager was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

To be completed within 1 year of today's date and to be monitored through WCS.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Justin B Hager in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count #2 is dismissed and read in.  The Court vacates and reinstates the $1250.00 signature bond ordered forfeited on 5/2/16 and forfeited on 6/21/16 by the Court. The Defendant was sentenced as follows:
FINE: $719.00 (apply cash bail and balance to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 9/15/16 or serve 9 days jail consecutive as penalty for non payment.)
DNA SURCHARGE: $250.00 (to be paid at $50.00 per month consecutive to payment on fine).
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
JAIL: 5 DAYS (CREDIT 5 DAYS) Time Served. 
OTHER: Perform 30 Hours Community Service within 1 year to be monitored by WCS.
Motion to forfeit bail granted.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 8, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Justin B Hager in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Scheis requests the Court schedule the matter for plea and sentencing in August as the Defendant is scheduled complete probation in July. The Court schedules accordingly.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 8, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Hearing on June 1, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
